files.README.md:
üêß Welcome to the Interactive Web Terminal!

‚ú® Features:
- Auto-completion with Tab
- Command history with ‚Üë/‚Üì arrows
- Theme switching (type 'theme')
- File system simulation
- Modern UI with glassmorphism effects

üìö Getting Started:
- Type 'help' to see all available commands
- Type 'ls' to list files in current directory
- Type 'cat filename' to read file contents
- Type 'cd directory' to change directories

üé® This is a simulation, not a real shell.
You can create your own config file for other Linux distros.

üí° Pro tip: Try typing 'neofetch' for system info!
files.notes.txt:

üöÄ Completed:

files..bashrc:
# ~/.bashrc

# If not running interactively, don't do anything
[[ $- != *i* ]] && return

# Aliases
alias ls='ls --color=auto'
alias ll='ls -alF'
alias la='ls -A'
alias l='ls -CF'
alias grep='grep --color=auto'

# Custom prompt
PS1='[\u@\h \W]\$ '

# History settings
HISTSIZE=1000
HISTFILESIZE=2000

# Enable programmable completion
if ! shopt -oq posix; then
  if [ -f /usr/share/bash-completion/bash_completion ]; then
    . /usr/share/bash-completion/bash_completion
  fi
fi
files.shortcuts.txt:
üîß Useful Keyboard Shortcuts:

üìå Terminal Navigation:
- Ctrl+C: Interrupt current command
- Tab: Auto-complete commands
- ‚Üë/‚Üì: Navigate command history
- Escape: Close suggestions

üé® Interface:
- Click theme button (üåô/‚òÄÔ∏è) to toggle themes
- Click anywhere in terminal to focus input
- Use window controls for simulated actions

üí° Pro Tips:
- Type partial command and press Tab for completion
- Use 'clear' to clean up the terminal
- Check 'history' to see your command history

motd: ‚ú® Features: Auto-completion | History | Themes | File System
üí° Type 'help' for available commands | 'theme' to toggle themes
üéØ Try: ls, cat README.md, cd projects, neofetch

help.description: Shows a list of available commands with descriptions

ls.description: Lists files and directories in the current location

pwd.description: Prints the current working directory path

uname.description: Shows system information (try 'uname -a' for detailed info)

uname -a.output: Linux arch-pc 6.5.9-arch1-1 #1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Sat Oct 28 13:58:31 UTC 2023 x86_64 GNU/Linux

uptime.description: Shows how long the system has been running

neofetch.description: Displays a colorful system information screen

echo.description: Displays the specified text or variables

head.description: Displays the first lines of a file

tail.description: Displays the last lines of a file

wc.description: Counts lines, words, and characters in files

touch.description: Creates new files or updates timestamps

mv.description: Moves or renames files and directories
